column4: hey people, can any one hint me towards some way of speeding up ubuntu, im running it on a old laptop
but seriously.  it can be trimmed to a lean system but turning off all the un-nesseccery stuff that starts at boot time and removing gnome and using xfce4 or fvwm  or the like.
want a list of what i have running so you kinda know what is needed ?
runlevel  will show what you are in now.
you probably only want to mess with S and 2
i think everything listed there is pretty essential.
whats the defult password for root?
there is no root password unless you set one.
yes and will run faster, but at the price of making some thing manual rather than auto.
if you can do most of your work from console and don't need all the eye candy a gui provides.  even a 386 is usable.   not fast, but usable.
what errors ?    and don't flood. use the pastebin if needed.
you didn't  ^C that thing did you ?
oh you want gdm/kdm/xdm   to run at boot?
if you are regestered you can....
